I am an Aspiring...

Educator

I am currently waiting to hear back from Universities in Glasgow regarding my application for a Professional Graduate Diploma in Education (PGDE). This will allow me to start my career as a computer science teacher in Scotland.

Due to the circumstances since my graduation from the University of Strathclyde in 2020 I have not had the opportunity to gain practical experience in the classroom. Nonetheless, as things open up soon here are a few things that I am looking forward to!

Talking
Teaching

Teaching Scotland are providing a number of seminars this January during their “Online Festival of Interactive Events”

Classroom
Observations

Having reached out to a number of local schools, as well as friends that are already teachers, the opportunity for classroom experience is just round the corner

Hello
Whorld!

Hello Whorld is a series of tutorials that I have been working on with the hope of volunteering in schools that cannot offer a Computer Science curriculum.

I believe that the most engaging, enjoyable and efficient way to learn is to learn by doing. In the Hello Whorld course participants will code, from scratch and alongside myself, their first website. By allowing students to create the website on whatever wild idea they can imagine, the process will be infused with inspiration whilst introducing skills and concepts that can be applied to all of Web Dev!

In particular the talks on "Life as a Teacher" and "Progression in Teaching" are appealing to me. Though I haven't begun my career yet I've no lack of ambition! The event should provide another opportunity to ask questions to newly qualified and more experienced teachers.

I also hope to chat with a number of experienced teachers about the job, speciffically elements of the proffession that are not class facing. This should help me prepare in the best way for the coming PGDE, pointing me towards the set of administrative and perhaps beuarocratic skills I should develope in the meantime.

As is customary for one at the start of a new road I have spent no short time daydreaming and imagining what kind of teacher I will be. I'm looking forward to experiencing a wide variety of teaching styles and philosophies such that my own can be challenged, refined and matured prior to placements.

Engineer

During my time at the University of Strathclyde I studied a wide range of Electronic and Electrical Engineering (EEE) concepts, from PCB and analogue circuit design to interpreted languages like Python 3. Since graduating I have continued to develop these skills in my own projects, which can be viewed in my portfolio

Technical Skills

Hover to read more!

Experience
Abstraction

Python 3

Python 3 is an interpreted and highly abstracted programing language, often used for machine learning and data science purposes. The simple syntax means that the language is easy to read and quick to learn for beginners, and cuts development time massively for more experienced programmers.

Git

A source control system is essential for any form of engineering, allowing many programmers to work on a project without conflicts. In an education context Git offers an easy way to grade individuals for their own contributions to a project, rather than the quality of the project overall. I believe this would allow a more fair way of encouraging team work.

Javascript

The programming language with which the modern internet is founded upon, JS has become the most languages today. Not only is the language easy to get started with but the extensive support for 3rd party libraries and frameworks means that the possibilities with it are endless.

HTML 5

Hyper Text Mark-up Language is used to describe the contents of a webpage in it's most basic and unadorned form. As such it provides a road-map for anyone viewing or writing the source code of a website. Well written and clean HTML is the foundation of most web development projects.

CSS 3

CSS is the visual design language that is used to format and style HTML by adding colors, fonts, positioning, scale etc. I consider myself to be hugely lucky that I began with the third iteration of Cascading Style Sheets. Ease of access to features like transitions, animations, flex and grid make simple what only a few years ago would have caused migraines.

SASS/SCSS

Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets is a further abstraction of CSS that introduces functions, nesting, reusable code and much, much more. This brings the visual design language to become more similar to the proggraming languages I am familiar with whilst helping me adhere to the fundamental "Don't repeat yourself" coding principle.

FPGA Verification

Field Programable Gate Arrays are integrated circuits that can be configured after manufacturing, providing an essential tool for prototyping new processors and ASICs. Having an interest in signal processing I used VHDL, system generator and Simulink to describe novel hardware frequently.

PCB Design

To many tedious, to me queerly therapeutic, Printed Circuit Board design is often like solving a puzzle. At it's core this involves optimization, creating all connections a circuit needs whilst minimizing the space on the board it takes. However the many nuances involved regarding path length, propagation delays and heat syncs mean that, to me at least, it is more art than science.

C++

C++ often serves as the bridge between hardware and software, since it adopts the memory management and efficiency of low level languages but also some of the abstractions of high level languages. For instance operating systems and video games are written in C++, allowing for extremely high performance. The sacrifice for this performance is a huge development time however, as C++ is a very labour intensive language to work with.

Embedded C

Programming microcontrollers allows your code to interact with the real world through sensors, motors, speakers or even just LEDs. Whilst my Uni projects revolved around the TIMSP430 most of my experience comes from personal projects using the ATMEGA328P and the Arduino development board.

Matlab

Matlab is the combination of a numeric computing environment and programing language that has a massive variety of uses in engineering. In my time at uni I used the environment extensively for Digital Signal Processing, data analysis and statistics. I also used Matlab's subset of programs, mostly Simulink and System Generator, in conjunction with Xillinx Design Suite for FPGA Verification

Project
Planning

Setting success criteria, prioritizing features, envisioning deadlines that account for inevitable delays. Many projects fail before they have even begun due to inadequate planning, which is a pitfall that I learned to avoid at university

Project
Management

For larger projects it was often necessary to collate the progress of the group and present to our mentor weekly. This meant ensuring each member of the group kept appropriate documentation and completed tasks on schedule.

Team
Work

Communication, sticking to deadlines and personal accountability have been essential attributes developed during my many group projects and reports at University.

Quick
Learning

The rate at which University threw new technologies and languages at us meant that learning new technologies became a skill in itself. This allows me to pick up new languages comfortably within a matter of weeks.

Developer

My engineering skill-set has lent itself well to web development, which has proven an exciting and engaging experience. My projects exploit my programming aptitude through extensive animations and transitions in order to hold the users attention. As my career advances I hope to hone the aesthetic elements of my web development and foster a stronger understanding of design principals.

What I'm working on..

Now

Javascript

Though I have taken to JS like a duck to water there is a depth of features that I have yet to explore. I intend to have a thorough grasp of Vanilla JS and its various nuances before moving on to any kind of framework

Soon

React

The framework created and used by Facebook, as well as Twitter and countless other popular sites. This should make dynamic and multi page websites much easier and quicker to create

Soonish

E-Commerce

Though it is true that my career will be in teaching, a diversified income is important. E-commerce will allow me to offer free-lance web dev services to a wider and more professional clientele

My Services

From getting your first business off the ground to getting ahead with the Scottish computing curriculum, I am here to help! Feel free to fire me a wee message about what I can do for you or any questions regarding pricing. I'm more than happy to chat!

Tutoring

You should always seek help from your teacher before considering a tutor, but if you feel a different approach will benefit your learning I can help wrap your head around what's going on in class. I offer tutoring services up to and including advance higher level through zoom or in person

Consultations

Sometimes you are just banging your head against a problem for days. Usually the solution is just a few lines of code away! If you are really stuck with something specific I can help set you on the right path with a one-off consultation.

Web Design

A strong digital presence has now become vital for any business or professional. Whether you need a portfolio for your work or a way to get your new bushiness off the ground I can offer fluid and unique web development to make sure that your brand will not be forgotten
